%text If $\cos^{-1} x = \theta$ then $\theta \in \left[0,\pi \right]$. But note that $\frac{8}{7} > 1\implies\frac{8\pi}{7} > \pi$ Which means that $\angb\notin\prng$. And hence $\cos^{-1}\left( \cos\angb\right)\neq\angb$ Instead, notice that % \begin{align}
\cos \left(\angb \right) &= \cos \left(2\pi-\angb \right) \\ &= \cos \left(\angc \right) \\ \text{And }\frac{6}{7} &< 1\implies \angc\in\prng \\ \therefore \cos^{-1}\left(\cos\angb \right) &= \angc \end{align} %text %
